title: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function during ops between cuda tensors
body_html:
Pytorch installed via conda, as well as all the optional dependencies, including magma-cuda80.
torch.cuda.is_available() prints True, but operations between tensors raise an error:

import torch

print(torch.cuda.is_available())

x = torch.ones(4, 4).cuda()
y = torch.ones(4, 4).cuda()

x + y


True
THCudaCheck FAIL file=/data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.6_1484802121799/work/torch/lib/THC/generated/../generic/THCTensorMathPointwise.cu line=246 error=8 : invalid device function
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gpistre/PycharmProjects/hellopytorch/cuda_test.py", line 8, in <module>
    x + y
  File "/home/gpistre/anaconda2/envs/py35/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 396, in __add__
    return self.add(other)
RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (8) : invalid device function at /data/users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch-0.1.6_1484802121799/work/torch/lib/THC/generated/../generic/THCTensorMathPointwise.cu:246

Pytorch installed via conda, as well as all the optional dependencies, including magma-cuda80.
`torch.cuda.is_available()` prints True, but operations between tensors raise an error: 

```
import torch

print(torch.cuda.is_available())

x = torch.ones(4, 4).cuda()
y = torch.ones(4, 4).cuda()

x + y

```
